column1: 1 ^ Attendite
column2: popule meus
column3: lēgem meam; inclīnāte aurem vestram in verba ōris meī. ^ Attend
column4: O my people
column5: to my law; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

column1: 2 ^ Aperiam in parabolīs ōs meum; loquar prōpositiōnēs ab initiō. ^ I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter propositions from the beginning.
3 ^ Quanta audīvimus
column2: et cognōvimus ea
column3: et patrēs nostrī narrāvērunt nōbīs. ^ How great things have we heard
column4: and we have known them
column5: and our fathers have told us.

column1: 4 ^ Nōn sunt occultāta ā fīliīs eōrum in generātiōne alterā. Narrantēs laudēs Dominī
column2: et virtūtēs ejus
column3: et mīrābilia ejus quae fēcit. ^ They have not been hidden from their children in another generation. Declaring the praises of the Lord
column4: and his powers
column5: and his wonders which he hath done.

column1: 5 ^ Et suscitāvit testimōnium in Jācōbe
column2: et lēgem posuit in Isrāēle
column3: quanta mandāvit patribus nostrīs nōta facere ea fīliīs suīs
column4: ^ And he set up a testimony in Jacob
column5: and made a law in Israel
column6: how great things he commanded our fathers that they should make them  known to their children

column1: 6 ^ ut cognōscat generātiō altera
column2: fīliī quī nāscentur
column3: et exsurgent et narrābunt fīliīs suīs
column4: ^ that another generation might know them
column5: sons that should be born
column6: and should rise up and declare them to their children.

column1: 7 ^ ut pōnant in Deō spem suam
column2: et nōn oblīvīscantur operum Deī
column3: et mandāta ejus exquīrant
column4: ^ that they may put their hope in God
column5: and may not forget the works of God

column1: 8 ^ nē fīant sīcut patrēs eōrum
column2: generātiō prāva et exasperans
column3: generātiō quae nōn dīrēxit cor suum
column4: et nōn est crēditus cum Deō spīritūs ejus. ^ that they may not become like their fathers
column5: a perverse and exasperating generation
column6: a generation that set not their heart aright
column7: and whose spirit was not faithful with God.

column1: 9 ^ Fīliī Efraim intendentēs et mittentēs arcum; conversī sunt in diē bellī. ^ The sons of Ephraim who bend and shoot with the bow; they have turned back in the day of battle.
10 ^ Nōn cūstōdīvērunt testāmentum Deī
column2: et in lēge ejus nōluērunt ambulāre. ^ They kept not the covenant of God
column3: and in his law they would not walk.

column1: 11 ^ Et oblītī sunt benefactōrum ejus
column2: et mīrābilium ejus quae ostendit eīs
column3: ^ And they forgot his benefits
column4: and his wonders that he had shown them

column1: 12 ^ cōram patribus eōrum fēcit mīrābilia in terrā Aegiptī
column2: in campō Taneos. ^ wonderful things did he do in the sight of their fathers in the land of Egypt
column3: in the field of Tanis.

column1: 13 ^ Interrūpit mare
column2: et perdūxit eōs; statuit aquās quasi in utre
column3: ^ He divided the sea
column4: and brought them through; he made the waters to stand as in a vessel.

column1: 14 ^ et dēdūxit eōs in nūbe diēī
column2: et tōtā nocte in illūminātiōne ignis. ^ and he conducted them with a cloud by day
column3: and all the night with a light of fire.

column1: 15 ^ Interrūpit petram in erēmō
column2: et adaquāvit eōs velut in abissō multā. ^ He struck the rock in the wilderness
column3: and gave them to drink as out of the great deep.

column1: 16 ^ Et ēdūxit aquam dē petrā
column2: et dēdūxit tamquam flūmina aquās. ^ And he brought forth water out of the rock
column3: and made streams run down as rivers.

column1: 17 ^ Et apposuērunt adhūc peccāre eī; in īram excitāvērunt Excelsum in inaquōsō. ^ And they added yet more sin against him; they provoked the most High to wrath in the place without water.
18 ^ Et tentāvērunt Deum in cordibus suīs
column2: ut peterent ēscās animābus suīs. ^ And they tempted God in their hearts
column3: by asking meat for their desires.

column1: 19 ^ Et male locūtī sunt dē Deō
column2: et dīxērunt: Numquid poterit Deus parāre mensam in dēsertō? ^ And they spoke ill of God
column3: and they said: Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

column1: 20 ^ Quoniam percussit petram
column2: et flūxērunt aquae
column3: et torrentēs inundāvērunt. Numquid et pānem poterit dare
column4: aut parāre mensam populō suō? ^ Because he struck the rock
column5: and the waters gushed out
column6: and the streams overflowed. Can he also give bread
column7: or provide a table for his people?

column1: 21 ^ Idiō audīvit Dominus
column2: et distulit
column3: et ignis accensus est in Jācōbe
column4: et īra ascendit in Isrāēle. ^ Therefore the Lord heard
column5: and was angry
column6: and a fire was kindled against Jacob
column7: and wrath came up against Israel.

column1: 22 ^ Quia nōn crēdidērunt in Deō
column2: nec spērāvērunt in salūtārī ejus. ^ Because they believed not in God
column3: and trusted not in his salvation.

column1: 23 ^ Et mandāvit nūbibus dēsuper
column2: et iānuās caelī aperuit. ^ And he had commanded the clouds from above
column3: and had opened the doors of heaven.

column1: 24 ^ Et pluit illīs mannam ad mandūcandum
column2: et pānem caelī dedit eīs. ^ And had rained down manna upon them to eat
column3: and had given them the bread of heaven.

column1: 25 ^ Pānem angelōrum mandūcāvit homō; cibāria mīsit eīs in abundantiā. ^ Man ate the bread of angels; he sent them provisions in abundance.
26 ^ Transtulit Austrum dē caelō
column2: et indūxit in virtūte suā Āfricum. ^ He removed the south wind from heaven
column3: and by his power brought in the southwest wind.

column1: 27 ^ Et pluit super eōs sīcut pulverem carnēs
column2: et sīcut arēnam maris volātilia pennāta. ^ And he rained upon them flesh as dust
column3: and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea.

column1: 28 ^ Et cecidērunt in mediō castrōrum eōrum
column2: circā tabernācula eōrum. ^ And they fell in the midst of their camp
column3: round about their pavilions.

column1: 29 ^ Et mandūcāvērunt
column2: et saturātī sunt nimis
column3: et dēsīderium eōrum attulit eīs; ^ So they did eat
column4: and were filled exceedingly
column5: and he gave them their desire;

column1: 30 ^ nōn sunt fraudātī ā dēsīderiō suō. Adhūc ēscae eōrum erant in ōre ipsōrum
column2: ^ they were not defrauded of that which they craved. As yet their meat was in their mouth

column1: 31 ^ et īra Deī ascendit super eōs
column2: et occīdit pinguēs eōrum
column3: et ēlectōs Isrāēlis impedīvit. ^ and the wrath of God came upon them
column4: and he slew the fat ones amongst them
column5: and brought down the chosen men of Israel.

column1: 32 ^ In omnibus hīs peccāvērunt adhūc
column2: et nōn crēdidērunt in mīrābilibus ejus. ^ In all these things they sinned still
column3: and they behaved not for his wondrous works.

column1: 33 ^ Et dēfēcērunt in vānitāte diēs eōrum
column2: et annī eōrum cum festīnātiōne. ^ And their days were consumed in vanity
column3: and their years with haste.

column1: 34 ^ Quum occīderet eōs
column2: quaerēbant eum
column3: et revertēbantur
column4: et dīlūculō veniēbant ad eum. ^ When he slew them
column5: then they sought him
column7: and came to him early in the morning.

column1: 35 ^ Et rememorātī sunt quia Deus adjūtor est eōrum
column2: et Deus excelsus redemptor eōrum est. ^ And they remembered that God was their helper
column3: and the most high God their redeemer.

column1: 36 ^ Et dīlēxērunt eum in ōre suō
column2: et linguā suā mentītī sunt eī. ^ And they loved him with their mouth
column3: and with their tongue they lied unto him.

column1: 37 ^ Cor autem eōrum nōn erat rectum cum eō
column2: nec fidēlēs habitī sunt in testāmentō ejus. ^ But their heart was not right with him
column3: nor were they counted faithful in his covenant.

column1: 38 ^ Ipse autem est misericors
column2: et propitius fīet peccātīs eōrum
column3: et nōn disperdet eōs
column4: et abundāvit ut āverteret īram suam
column5: et nōn accendit omnem īram suam. ^ But he is merciful
column8: and many a time did he turn away his anger
column9: and did not kindle all his wrath.

column1: 39 ^ Et recordātus est quia carō sunt
column2: spīritus vādens et nōn rediens. ^ And he remembered that they are flesh
column3: a wind that goeth and returneth not.

column1: 40 ^ Quotiēs exacerbāvērunt eum in dēsertō; in īram concitāvērunt eum in inaquōsō. ^ How often did they provoke him in the desert; they moved him to wrath in the place without water.
41 ^ Et conversī sunt
column2: et tentāvērunt Deum
column3: et sanctum Isrāēlis exacerbāvērunt. ^ And they turned back
column4: and tempted God
column5: and grieved the holy one of Israel.

column1: 42 ^ Nōn sunt recordātī manūs ejus
column2: diē quā redēmit eōs dē manū trībulantis; ^ They remembered not his hand
column3: in the day that he redeemed them from the hand of him that afflicted them;

column1: 43 ^ sīcut posuit in Aegiptō signa sua
column2: et prōdigia sua in campō Taneos. ^ how he wrought his signs in Egypt
column3: and his wonders in the field of Tanis.

column1: 44 ^ Et convertit in sanguinem flūmina eōrum
column2: et imbrēs eōrum
column3: nē biberent. ^ And he turned their rivers into blood
column4: and their showers that they might not drink.

column1: 45 ^ Mīsit in eōs cinomiam
column2: et comēdit eōs
column3: et rānam
column4: et disperdidit eōs. ^ He sent amongst them divers sorts of flies
column5: and it devoured them

column1: 46 ^ Et dedit aerūginī fructūs eōrum
column2: et labōrēs eōrum locustae. ^ And he gave up their fruits to the blast
column3: and their labours to the locust.

column1: 47 ^ Et occīdit in grandine vīneās eōrum
column2: et mōrōs eōrum in pruīnā. ^ And he destroyed their vineyards with hail
column3: and their mulberry trees with hoarfrost.

column1: 48 ^ Et trādidit grandinī jūmenta eōrum
column2: et possessiōnem eōrum ignī. ^ And he gave up their cattle to the hail
column3: and their stock to the fire.

column1: 49 ^ Mīsit in eōs īram indignātiōnis suae
column2: indignātiōnem et īram et trībulātiōnem
column3: immissiōnēs per angelōs malōs. ^ And he sent upon them the wrath of his indignation
column4: indignation and wrath and trouble
column5: a sending forth by evil angels.

column1: 50 ^ Viam fēcit sēmitae īrae suae; nōn pepercit ā morte animābus eōrum
column2: et jūmenta eōrum in morte conclūsit. ^ He made a way for a path to his anger; he spared not their souls from death
column3: and their cattle he shut up in death.

column1: 51 ^ Et percussit omne prīmōgenitum in terrā Aegiptī; prīmitiās omnis labōris eōrum in tabernāculīs Cham. ^ And he killed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt; the firstfruits of all their labour in the tabernacles of Cham.
52 ^ Et abstulit sīcut ovēs populum suum
column2: et perdūxit eōs tamquam gregem in dēsertō. ^ And he took away his own people as sheep
column3: and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

column1: 53 ^ Et dēdūxit eōs in spē
column2: et nōn timuērunt
column3: et inimīcōs eōrum operuit mare. ^ And he brought them out in hope
column4: and they feared not
column5: and the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

column1: 54 ^ Et indūxit eōs in montem sanctificātiōnis suae
column2: montem quem acquīsīvit dexterā ejus. ^ And he brought them into the mountain of his sanctuary
column3: the mountain which his right hand had purchased.

column1: 55 ^ Et ēiēcit ā faciē eōrum Gentēs
column2: et sorte dīvīsit eīs terram in fūniculō distribūtiōnis
column3: et habitāre fēcit in tabernāculīs eōrum tribūs Isrāēlis. ^ And he cast out the Gentiles before them
column4: and by lot divided to them their land by a line of distribution
column5: and he made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tabernacles.

column1: 56 ^ Et tentāvērunt
column2: et exacerbāvērunt Deum excelsum
column3: et testimōnia ejus nōn cūstōdīvērunt. ^ Yet they tempted
column4: and provoked the most high God
column5: and they kept not his testimonies.

column1: 57 ^ Et āvertērunt sē
column2: et nōn servāvērunt pactum
column3: quemadmodum patrēs eōrum; conversī sunt in arcum prāvum. ^ And they turned away
column4: and kept not the covenant
column5: even like their fathers; they were turned aside as a crooked bow.

column1: 58 ^ In īram concitāvērunt eum in collibus suīs
column2: et in sculptilibus suīs ad aemulātiōnem eum prōvocāvērunt. ^ They provoked him to anger on their hills
column3: and moved him to jealousy with their graven things.

column1: 59 ^ Audīvit Deus
column2: et sprēvit
column3: et ad nihilum redēgit valdē Isrāēlem. ^ God heard
column4: and despised them
column5: and he reduced Israel exceedingly as it were to nothing.

column1: 60 ^ Et repulit tabernāculum Sīlō
column2: tabernāculum suum
column3: ubi habitāvit in hominibus. ^ And he put away the tabernacle of Silo
column4: his tabernacle
column5: where he dwelt among men.

column1: 61 ^ Et trādidit in captīvitātem virtūtem eōrum
column2: et pulchritūdinem eōrum in manūs inimīcī. ^ And he delivered their strength into captivity
column3: and their beauty into the hands of the enemy.

column1: 62 ^ Et conclūsit in gladiō populum suum
column2: et hērēditātem suam sprēvit. ^ And he shut up his people under the sword
column3: and he despised his inheritance.

column1: 63 ^ Juvenēs eōrum comēdit ignīs
column2: et virginēs eōrum nōn sunt lāmentātae. ^ Fire consumed their young men
column3: and their maidens were not lamented.

column1: 64 ^ Sacerdōtēs eōrum in gladiō cecidērunt
column2: et viduae eōrum nōn plōrābantur. ^ Their priests fell by the sword
column3: and their widows did not mourn.

column1: 65 ^ Et excitātus est tamquam dormiens Dominus
column2: tamquam potens crāpulātus ā vīnō. ^ And the Lord was awaked as one out of sleep
column3: so as a mighty man that hath been surfeited with wine.

column1: 66 ^ Et percussit inimīcōs suōs in posteriōra; opprobrium sempiternum dēdit illīs. ^ And he smote his enemies on the hinder parts; he put them to an everlasting reproach.
67 ^ Et repulit tabernāculum Jōsēfī
column2: et tribum Efraim nōn ēlēgit
column3: ^ And he rejected the tabernacle of Joseph
column4: and chose not the tribe of Ephraim

column1: 68 ^ sed ēlēgit tribum Jūdae
column2: montem Sion quem dīlēxit. ^ but he chose the tribe of Judah
column3: mount Sion which he loved.

column1: 69 ^ Et aedificāvit sīcut ūnicornium sanctificium suum
column2: in terrā quam fundāvit in saecula. ^ And he built his sanctuary as of unicorns
column3: in the land which he founded for ever.

column1: 70 ^ Et ēlēgit Dāvid servum suum
column2: et sustulit eum dē gregibus ovium; ^ And he chose his servant David
column3: and took him from the flocks of sheep;

column1: 71 ^ Dē post fētantēs accēpit eum
column2: pāscere Jācōbem servum suum
column3: et Isrāēlem hērēditātem suam. ^ he brought him from following the ewes great with young
column4: to feed Jacob his servant
column5: and Israel his inheritance.

column1: 72 ^ Et pāvit eōs in innocentiā cordis suī
column2: et in intellectibus manuum suārum dēdūxit eōs. ^ And he fed them in the innocence of his heart
column3: and conducted them by the skilfulness of his hands.
